ratings.comment: Amazing lecturer who comes off as very sincere and fair.  His grading is not harsh, but I came away from the class confident that I knew the material.  I'm glad I got the chance to have Dr. Angenent as a teacher.

Professor Angenent is the best professor I have had at UW Madison. This class is very difficult in general, but he makes it so much easier to understand. You can feel his passion through his teaching, and he genuinely cares about his students so much. If you have to take MATH341, definitely take him!

Professor Angenent wants you to succeed. He's very eager to answer questions, both in class and on Piazza, and he's fair about grading curves. All class lectures are accessible on Canvas. The homework assignments and other class resources prepare you for the two midterms and the final.

Sigurd is a very caring and inspirational professor for advanced math and research. His lectures are very concise and easy to follow. He always gives students an intuition how and why it works. I was in a research group on the curve shortening flow and the professor made the class very interesting. Highly recommended.
Angenent is very accessible outside of class, will answer literally any question you can think of in a digestible manner. Respected throughout the math department.
Really clear and intuitive explanation with good pictures. Doesn't assign homework until last three weeks of class. Hope for more consistent assignments.

Professor Angenent is a real gem at UW-Madison. He is well-known all over the world in mathematics. His lectures are clear and comprehensive. He is very kind and respectable towards students. His knowledge is beyond this world and I would say that he is one of the best mathematicians in the US. I would surely take another class. Great lectures!

One of the best professors I've had by far at UW. Turned a usually difficult class into something that was seemingly easy. Homework well-prepared you for the exams and was very fair in terms of grading and tests. Clearly wanted students to do well and cares a lot.

He's very kind, goes through enough examples and provide visuals so all the students understand. Really chose to focus on the basics of set theory and linear algebra, which is how 341 meant to be. Homework prepares you well for the exams.

Sigurd is the best math professor I had at this school. Actually he is definitely one of the best professors I have during my college career. He is very friendly, respectful and helpful. I would love to take his class again.

I took math 421 with Sigurd and I say he is the best math professor I ever had at this school. He is respectful and helpful. His lectures are very useful and we dont even need to buy textbooks. Id love to take his classes again.

Such a great professor. He explains the "why" behind difficult concepts, which makes it all make sense. Real Analysis can be a tough subject but his exams and homework are fair and you really learn so much. He cares about his students.

Professor Angenent was very clear in lectures and was careful to walk through difficult topics with lots of examples and intuitive reasoning. He is an extremely friendly person and is always helpful in his office hours. Practice exams are very indicative of the actual exams; there are no surprises. I would be glad to take another course with him.

Sigurd was hands down the best math professor I have had at UW. He made Stochastic Processes/Markov Chains clear and interesting while still expecting a lot out of students. Wish I had taken more of his classes!

Sigurd is a great professor. He is very enthusiastic and has the rare capability of being able to simplify difficult topics in multivariable calculus. He posts useful study guides before the exams. I would definitely recommend!

This class was very easy to pass because Professor Angenent would post a study guide before the tests with everything on it. This made the class very predictable. Lectures aren't that important as long as you kinda know what's going on. He is interesting and funny so that's a plus.
Prof Angenents lectures are clear and the tests are straightforward. There are not many extra resources for the class but overall it is easy enough material to do well.
Best math professor I've had. Wish I had taken another course with him before I graduated. He's really really clear, really nice, and his exams are extremely fair and easy.
Just six words: BEST PROFESSOR. TAKE 521 WITH HIM.

Overall, would recommend.  Homework is reasonable, but tests can be hard. Lectures are sometimes a bit dry, but they are always clear. Some thought that the textbook (Rudin), was dense, but I thought it was alright. No office hours, answered questions on piazza instead. Overall, a good professor
Take 521 with him. He is the best  math professor ever!!!!

Real analysis isn't a very easy subject by any means, and mathematical proofs in general can be hard to follow, but Professor Angenent knows how to make this stuff make sense. I've never felt lost in his class.

Sigurd is amazing. His lectures are very clear and inspiring. He comes up with proofs with diagrams and motivates students to think with his hints. Exams and grading are very fair. That being said, you will definitely learn more and get less pain from him than others. If you have a chance to take a course with him, register without hesitation!

The best professor I have ever had! He cares about intuitions and examples that can helps a lot for understanding (and also useful for future proof by contradictions!). He is a really nice guy, and his lectures are amazingly organized. We are using one of the worst textbook (super hard and dry), but his class is the most interesting and intuitive
Amazing lecture. He is one of the best lecturer in maths department to explain things.

Incredible. If have the good fortune to be able to take a class with this guy you should. Very clear explainations and really emphasizes what is important. Tests and homework are at just at the right level to be challenging but doable. Also, he is just an extremely nice guy.

Super easy lecturer; did not cover all of the topics, was very slow in terms of pace, exams were very easy. Take him if you want a very easy version of calc 3 where you won't learn as much as you would with a more rigorous professor. HW not required.

Best math teacher around. He does not grade homework, but if you are keeping up with the discussion quizes, you'll be fine. Very reasonable with students. More theory based than practical based. Very efficient with use of lectures and students' time in general.

Sigurd is a great professor. His lectures can get off topic sometimes but usually what he is talking about is still interesting. The best part of this class compared to other 234 classes I knew others were taking were that the test questions were very predictable and the test were SUPER easy for a multivariable calc course.

Sigurd was an incredible professor.  I had previously taken Calc 3 with Bing Wang and had to drop the class because he was such a bad professor.  SIgurd is infinitely better.  He is easy to understand and only teaches the necessary material that will be on a test.

Professor Angenent is the best professor I've had in the UW math department. His explanations are clear and he is very helpful in elaborating on class concepts in office hours. I felt the course was too slow in the beginning, but it did provide a thorough foundation for later concepts. I hope to take another class with him in the future.
Professor Angenent gives slow but clear lectures. Tests are very fair, especially because of the test expectations he gives.

Ange goes pretty slow compared to most calc professors. This has its advantages and its pitfalls. Given that calc 3 is only a 200-level course, however, I think he is a fantastic professor. His lectures are easy to follow and the exams are super reasonable.
Unclear explanation and sometimes goes out of topic. Never take his class. The discussion helped me through otherwise I'll never understand anything.

Lectures very well and truly has a passion for teaching students. He wrote all of the calculus packets, so he is all about teaching people. His tests are the easiest math exams I have ever had. Just wants to have everyone understand the concepts well and is willing to give the whole class and A. Very cool guy.

Professor Angenent was the author of the 234 course packet so he really knows his stuff. He uses lots of examples so you don't leave class feeling panicked and is an engaging lecturer. His exams are beyond easy the class average on the last one was 94%. If you do have any questions he is super approachable and genuinely want his students to do well

Sigurd is an amazing professor. His lectures are very clear and he doesn't waste time teaching pointless topics. There are no surprises on the exams he prepares you very well. I highly recommend this professor, he is one of my favorites.

Sigurd is awesome!  Extremely helpful professor who explains things in a clear, concise manor.  The text was written by him but is actually quite useless.  No curve for the class but tests were quite fair.

This is a really good teacher. He explains all of the concepts very clearly and the tests are very fair. The text can be misleading though, the homework is difficult compared to the tests and there are quite a few mistakes. The key to this class is going to lecture and asking for help.

Decent teacher with appropriate amounts of homework, quizzes, and tests. Has a lot of math-related jokes and is a generally jovial guy. Lecture did not relate to discussions, however. I would recommend him to people who are unsure which math class to take.

Highly recommend this guy.  Lectures can be a little confusing or not really applicable at times but his really dry humor will keep you interested.  Homework problems are usually pretty basic and they are very similar, or exactly the same, as test and quiz problems.  Overall low workload and straightforward testing, what more can you ask for.
Pretty cool guy he explains things very well and i didnt even mind going to lecture
He isn't a bad teacher but not the best either. The course is difficult by nature but there are some concepts that he assumes the class already knows.
Midterm 1&2 are easy but 3 is a little bit difficult. He's a good teacher with lecture notes online.
He is a very nice person and understanding but his book is horrible. His examples and proofs are either too easy to apply to harder problems or are too complicated to understand.

He doesn't teach you what you need to know, just what he likes to talk about. He does elaborate proofs/problems that aren't relevant to what's on the test. He leaves a lot up to the TAs, so it's important you have an amazing TA in order to do well in his course. The textbook he wrote is awful, it's very unclear and full of errors.
He is an awful professor. His book is basically useless, because it has mistakes consistently through the whole book. Don't take any of his classes, steer clear of him.

Sigurd is one of the best maths instructors that one could hope for.  His lectures are clear and precise--with a dash of dry humor.  Exams require you to understand the material in depth.  There is a reason I plan on taking his class a third semester in a row!

This guy, who's incredibly dry for a teacher, decided to make his own terrible textbook for both semesters of Calc. Not only are there mistakes everywhere, but there are no answers in his "book." Instead of making us buy this piece of crap book, I would rather have an actual book from a legitimate source, rather than not knowing answers to his q's.
Went into incredible detail about the proofs for the calc. The lectures are not the most exciting lectures in the world.

Only take this class if you absolutely need to. If you tested out of it, do not take this class to get a "basis in college calculus" because it is a class of proofs of calculus theories. Unfortunately, Angenent is the "best" prof to take 221 with, even though he rambled on and on about the simple topics but almost never got to the difficult ones.
He was a great teacher. Wrote the text so his examples were like ones in the book. Easy to understand. Exams aren't horrible. Class is curved at the end.
Sigurd is very nice and funny, but it IS Calculus. It's not a fun class. It's challenging and the lectures drag on. You should definitely only take it if you need it for your major.

Sigurd simply put is the epitome of awesome. I was very fortunate to have had him as a professor. More than anything else I really gained an excellent understanding about math. His class can be very easy if you take advantage of all the resources he offers you, which are many. He is remarkably witty and is amazingly clear. An amazing teacher!

Very helpful if you utilize his office hours. Gives clear examples in lecture, but sometimes the examples lack difficulty. He even has a sense of humor. Very dry humor. The first test for 221 was incredibly hard (average 66) but the second midterm balanced it out.
Nice professor, very clear. Exams are not very hard.

He really is the greatest professor I have ever met!!!! The exams are not hard at all and he has review sections!! As long as you do the sample exam you'll probably get an A. He also gives extra credits policy!! Just take his class!!!! His lectures are really clear. I doubt if there is anyone cannot his lecture!

Absolutely horrible. There is not point in going to lecture because it wont help with the test. the "textbook" was written extremely poorly and probably by him. i took calc before and did very well, what he teaches i question to even be calculus. you cant even find what he teaches online to even try and figure it out yourself. UW needs to fix this

I don't know why the ratings on here are so good. I got a B in calculus in high school & a 4 on the AP exam (took it again for an easy first semester) but I'm almost failing. The textbook is poorly organized and the homework problems are very algebra intensive and a waste of time. Tests are very difficult. Don't take this class.

The course is not that bad at all, but there are a lot of relatively new concepts that you need to learn. Out of ALL the Math 221 professors, Prof. Angenent gives the HARDEST TESTS, but on the other hand he is ABSOLUTELY BEST at explaining concepts and answering questions. Attend his lectures regularily and you will do fine
Sigurd is a great teacher who writes notes for the students, so you don't have to buy a textbook. He breaks down extremely complex topics into easier to understand ideas.
Breaks everything down to an understandable level.
Had him for math 234 as well. Great professor, easy to get a A.
Best math professor i have met so far. It's easy to get A for his class.

Sigurd was the best professor I've had in Madison so far. He teaches somewhat out of the book, but uses lecture notes a lot. He teaches you what you need to know without the unnecessary stuff. Would recommend to anyone.

If you can have this guy for 234 TAKE HIM!  I was a bit worried in the beginning having lecture notes, but that's the best part of it; he doesn't expect you to know anything outside his lecture notes.  Also, he gives out practice exams that are the same format as the actual exam - he only changes around numbers pretty much.  Take this guys for an A

Wow that was an easy class.  He was incredibly easy to follow in lecture although he did occasionally throw in some pointless proofs.  Don't let the name fool you, he speaks perfect English.  Exams were some of the easiest I've ever had.  Honestly i nearly failed my last math class and I got a 100 on one exam and a 95 on another.
I wish Sigurd was my grandpa.
Easy tests. Teaches you everything you need for homework and tests. Also, exams are short and in class.
The thing i miss most about the University of Wisconsin is Sigurd Angenent. Enough said.

I was worried about the notes instead of the textbook at first, but the good thing about the notes is that he knows them inside and out because he wrote them (plus they're cheap)! Clear and concise lectures. Exams are much like the practice problems. Just do the work and go to class and you'll do well in his class.

Angenent is amazing! His ability to draw 3-D structures is impressive. There is no textbook and gives us his own notes, which are the same things he says in lecture. Lecture can be boring, but I think this guy is hilarious without trying or realizing. The exams are identical to his assigned homework problems and the practice exams. Smart guy!

I wish you could flag commenters for being dumb. If you can't learn from this guy, math is just not your thing. Learn how to do the practice tests and you'll do fine on exams. Lecture isn't always necessary, but it helps. The best part is saving money with the lecture notes. Funny guy, good class. Had him for 222 and 234(easier), Sigurd is the man.

Went to every one of Angenent's lectures and none seemed to help what so ever on exams.  Frequently goes on tangents about real world applications rather than actually teaching concepts.  Exams are insanely difficult especially the final worth nearly have the course points.  Avoid this professor, especially for calc 3.
Take him at any cost
He is a really good professor and one of the best calc 234 teachers. Gives clear lectures and he only tests the main ideas. He also has a good but subtle sense of humor. Take him if you can.
nvr went to lecture once and I got a B
Angenent is the man. If you have to take calc, take him.
Great guy, awesome professor. Take him!

Has his own notes which only cost about $10 total. Only gripe, was they didn't provide enough examples (but it's easy enough to find them elsewhere). Tests were easy if you understand the practice exams he provides.
He is the man... Always crystal clear + dry, extremely dry jokes. TAKE HIM.
You have to be pretty keen to pick up on his subtle jokes... but I think he is an informative and interesting professor.

omg take him if u can. A great professor. his lectures can be boring sometimes frankly i dozed off lot of times but go to his office hours or your TAs and u will do gr8. just do the practice problems he gives before exams thoroughly and u will do gr8. great curve easy exams. plus u don't hav to buy the book so thats good. SERIOUSLY TAKE HIM

Angenent is clear and concise.  He does a good job of explaining the material in the most simple way possible.  He also keeps the material relative, making future topics easier to understand.  His exams are also exactly what you would expect with no bs.  Highly suggest.
Sigurd Angenent is a player.

He connects new ideas to old, which makes learning easy.  However, most of his classes are spent on derivations that we don't need to know.  His textbook is straightforward, albeit a bit slim on examples and in-depth explanation.  Overall, a good professor!

Had him for 222. his lectures are interesting at best. He does teach STRAIGHT from the "book" that he has made. But before midterms he hands out extremely helpful study guides and most the time the tests are a lot like them. I got an AB and B on his tests and i am a bad test taker. Very fair when it comes to midterms; final was impossible

Sigurd is EXTREMELY unhelpful. His lectures are confusing and off topic and his book is almost word for word what he says in class so learning on your own is extremely difficult. Also, his tests are way different then what he says they'll be like prior to taking them. DON'T take his class!!

He was not a good prof.  he has his own "book" which is completely useless and doesn't teach you anything.  The tests were so random, you had to ask if he ever covered some of the stuff in class.  Overall, the book is what kills the class.  not a great lecturer either.

I had Sigurd for both221 and 222.  The notes were great for me as it saved $.  Ppl who like learning from a book won't like the notes though. The answers he gives for HW have a lot of errors which is a pain. Tests were fair but the classes he teaches are pretty hard. Sigurd is really quirky and speaks perfectly clear. Liked him enough to take again

He's really quirky and it's super entertaining. I'd had calculus before, so I liked that he showed the proofs in lecture, but it made a few of my friends confused as hell. You don't have to take notes on them or know them for the tests, except for frickin epsilon-delta proofs. His wife taught my class the last two weeks, and she was a lot clearer.
He is a good professor and i really enjoyed him.  Easy to follow if you go to lecture. A lot of proofs during lecture, but it helps show how the formulas were derived. A fair grader.
This guys is so hot.  I want to bang him so hard.  I really want him to stick his schmag in my schmag.
Pass on this teacher. My suitemate has his wife and we agree that she teaches the same class far better. If you could avoid him, I would

Ok teacher.  Boring lectures and gives more proofs then examples which makes the class more difficult than it should be.  Doesn't use a textbook, but uses his own lecture notes which does save you money.  Lecture notes although have plenty of errors and very few examples.

loved this professor. cool guy. funny too. he is my favorite so far at madison. you dont need to buy the book cause he makes his own lecture notes for you to buy ($10) and use. they are easy to follow but if you go to class you hardly need them. i had him for 221 and 222 and i got an A on every exam. he is a fair grader and will make the curve easi
This guy is pretty funny, not to mention a good teacher, if you can't learn from him you have a problem.

He is an alright guy, but boring. From someone who has taken calculus before, my biggest thing against him is that he uses his own lecture notes which are basically useless, riddled with errors, and show few examples besides proofs. Change professors if you get him.
This guy is sooooo bomb!! No textbook, just lecture notes. Exams are exactly like example problems from notes. Oh and bonus... i math teacher that can speak english!

Sigurd was a really great professor. He was always very clear and straightforward and did lots of examples. I really enjoyed his lectures; they were useful and he was funny. I really liked how he used the typed notes rather than the textbook- the notes were clear and had good examples. I definitely recommend Sigurd for any math class.
